name: (2024) Premium High Arch Insoles for Ultimate Support - Plantar Fasciitis - Comfort for Foot Pain Relief - Anti-Fatigue - Orthotic Shoe Sole Inserts Men Women Standing All Day (Flame, XL)
about_this_item: Customize your fit: Ensure accurate shoe size verification and select the appropriate arch type that matches your foot's natural arch
Superior foot alignment: Orthotic inserts provide the necessary support for high arches, promoting proper foot alignment and alleviating plantar fasciitis pain
Improved balance and stability: Enhance your balance and stability during various activities such as running, walking, sports, or extended periods of standing with high arch insoles

Excellent shock absorption: Reduce impact on feet, knees, and joints with insoles designed for effective shock absorption. The deep heel cradle ensures stability and maintains correct foot alignment for greater comfort.
Compatible with multiple shoe type: Our orthotics for flat feet seamlessly integrate with different shoe styles, from athletic to formal, offering balance improvement for any occasion
Breaking-in Period: Pressure on the feet may be felt during the first 3-7 days. Start with 2-5 hours of wear daily, gradually increasing the duration
Shop with confidence: Enjoy a year of protection on your insoles, and reach out to us if you encounter any issues, even after trimming them

title: Perfect
content: I was extremely upset after purchasing some new balance shoes because they claimed to have excellent arch support and the reviews very much supported that claim, but when I put them on my ankles folded inward immediately. Most modern shoes seem to have this weird inward slant to them and it hurts my feet, ankles, knees, and hips. I'm really glad that these insoles fixed the problem. I have so many shoe options now that I know I can use these insoles to fix poorly designed shoes. I am using these in combination with the super squishy insole that comes with the newbalances and I think if I didn't have that extra cushion these might be a bit too hard for my taste. Pretty minor flaw, all things considered.

title: Pronounced support - Great for me but may be "too much" for some people
content: For my particular foot and gait issues, having proper arch support makes a big difference in terms of how much pain I am in at the end of the day.  These insoles provide a pronounced level of support, and I find them very helpful.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2024

title: Great arch support & stability for overpronators!
content: If you are unaccustomed to having this much support, you should follow their advice as to how to go about getting used to using these.  Also be aware that these insoles do take up more room in your shoes than flat ones do.  That means they may not work in certain footwear that fits closely and cannot be adjusted (or adjusted "enough") by loosening the laces.  In addition, I think that they may raise your heels up (inside the shoe) ever so slightly, which may alter the fit of some of your shoes so that the top edge of them is touching the backs of your heels in a different (and less comfortable) place.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024

title: Wonderful!

title: Provide excellent support
content: These arch support inserts from CRUVHEAL arrived just as pictured & described. I ordered these for my daughter who suffers with overpronation. I was a bit hesitant to order this set due to the “high arch” description which can be misinterpreted. They are indeed orthotic inserts which are meant to support high arched & flat feet individuals along w/overpronators who need extra stability. I’m not sure they would work for supination bcuz the arch measures 1 3/8” at its highest point. I ordered her the Lg. due to her wearing a size 11 womens shoe. They were a tad big however, they come w/a double sided template which you’re able to cut & test fit inside your shoes b4 trimming the actual inserts. Although the insoles are easy to cut, I highly suggest using a sharp scissors so you don’t end up w/jagged edges.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2024

title: Great customer service
content: My daughter has been amazed the last 10 days of wearing due to their comfortability & support. Although, she’s worn orthotics the last 3 years these have become her new “favorites”. She shared that her ankles, feet, & arches are no longer aching & sore after being on her feet for hours at a time. The deeper gel heel cup (measuring close to 1”) provides excellent shock absorption w/every single step. They also provide stability & cushioning which helps keep her feet better aligned. *NOTE* if you’re new to orthotic’s they can be uncomfortable in the beginning bcuz your feet aren’t accustomed to the extra support they provide. It’s best to wear for 1-2 hours then gradually increase in order to feel the optimal benefits they provide.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2024

title: Great Support
content: I deducted 1-star because the insoles are on the thinner side when compared to her old orthotics.

title: Good quality, but some sizing issues
content: I generally wear an 11.5 with a couple pairs at 12. I ordered the large size hoping these would be about a perfect fit. However, I compared them to some existing insoles that I already had, with size markings on the back, and as far as I can tell, these are only about 10.5. So a bit smaller than I needed. The arch support was a little further back than I would’ve liked, and I think this might be partially due to the sizing issue. They do seem quite well-made. The foam is soft and provides good cushioning, and they are topped with a nice felt-like layer.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2024

title: Good quality
content: These are pretry good quality, i  am a size 8 but i still have to cut a small part of it to fit.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2024

title: Provides good support, but requires some changes
content: My wife has high arches and so we wanted to try these out to see if they fit the bill. She says they actually feel really nice and provide a lot of support. The only downsides she said were, firstly, that as she walks, she feels like her foot is going to slide out of her shoe because it raised her whole foot a little to the point where it feels like her shoe could fall off. Secondly, she said that it pushed up her foot enough to where it was pushing it into the top of her shoe, so she needs to adjust her shoes to be looser on the top of her foot. If you can work around these two things, these are a pretty good value and do the job you are looking for.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2024
